intro: Bossiaea sulcata, commonly known as the serrated bossiaea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, serrated leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are typically clustered in dense inflorescences. It is often found in sandy or rocky soils in arid and semi-arid regions. Bossiaea sulcata is adapted to drought conditions and is an important component of local ecosystems.
